thread.title: 'Wanna pet my roo?': Yellow Tail's Super Bowl ad 'humilates' Australia
thread.title_full: 'Wanna pet my roo?': Yellow Tail's Super Bowl ad 'humilates' Australia

title: 'Wanna pet my roo?': Yellow Tail's Super Bowl ad 'humilates' Australia
text:
The ad was also singled out for sexism for its showcasing the Australian model/actor Ellie Gonsalves‚Äô ability to wear a white bikini and walk on a beach. 
‚ÄúHi,‚Äù the presenter says to Gonsalves. ‚ÄúWanna pet my roo?‚Äù 
‚ÄúSure,‚Äù says Gonsalves. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll pat your roo.‚Äù (News.com.au, meanwhile, took issue with the ‚Äúunusually sexual‚Äù kangaroo.) 
The ‚ÄúYellow Tail Guy‚Äù, as the company wishes for him to be known, concludes his case for the wine by entreating audiences: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Yellow Tail!‚Äù Miss Representation (@RepresentPledge) Your major consumer base (women) know what you mean by "roo" and we're #NotBuyingIt @yellowtail_usa. #3percentSB #malegaze #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/NG1WIbiphc February 6, 2017 Emily Walt (@emilyhwalt) No @yellowtailwine I do not want pet your "Roo" and now don't want to buy your wine. #NotBuyingIt Sam Weller (@samwe11er) Horrendous sexist shithouse commercial during the #SuperBowl - good thing we would never drink Yellow Tail anyway pic.twitter.com/rUTZA86vcg February 6, 2017 
Yellow Tail, stylised as ‚Äú[yellow tail]‚Äù and named for the yellow-footed rock wallaby that appears on its label, bills itself as a ‚Äúwine brand inspired by fun‚Äù. It is owned by Casella Family Brands, which began as a family winery in the Riverina region of New South Wales in 1969. 
According to Casella, it exports more than 12.5m cases of Yellow Tail to more than 50 countries every year; more than 2.5m glasses are consumed each day. A bottle retails for approximately A$9 (US$6.90). 
Yellow Tail enjoyed considerable success in the US after its launch in 2001. The Super Bowl spot kicks off a new, three-year marketing campaign ‚Äì a renewed push into the US market. But, perhaps unsurprisingly, the ad is not of Australian origin. 
According to AdNews , it was directed by Harald Zwart, a Dutch-Norwegian film-maker, known for the 2010 Karate Kid reboot and 2009‚Äôs The Pink Panther 2. It was devised by the New York-based advertising agency Burns Group. Ellie Gonsalves (@EllieGonsalves) Wanna pet my roo? Who caught the @yellowtailwine Super Bowl commercial?! #SB51 #PatsNation can the Pats come back? ü§ûüèΩüôèüèº pic.twitter.com/XsVGeGwwmg
